captions.text:
Hey Vsauce I'm Jake and I'm on a couch in
San Francisco slowly slipping into a coma

after eating this bacon and egg cheeseburger
that was sandwiched between two donuts. I

can burn those calories by seeing how fast
I can go in the 100 meter scroll which might

be slightly better than people in pizza slice
costumes becoming pizzas .com and here are
30 more things you can do online now, guys...DONGs.

See the population statistics for the country
you live with World Population Meters. The

website tells you how many people died, how
many were born and the total number of people

in every country, giving a net growth per
day and year in real time.

But Here is Today, a really interesting site
that compares today to as far back as we can

date, putting into perspective just how small
right now is.

Lets live in the past and the present by playing
old handheld games online at Pica Pic. They

have ones like the Game&Watch Donkey Kong,
Bartman, and a personal favorite of mine the
Tiger Electronic's The Terminator.

Then get even more old school and use steam
power to play YouTube videos like your grandpa

had too (what did you say, Jake? Nothing,
grandpa!). Tweak the cranks to get the best

quality and see how long you can keep it at
its peak. Just watch that pressure gauge because
you don't want a leek...
spin.com...

Peter Norvig might have created one of the
longest palindromic sentences at 17,826 words.

You can read it either forward or backward
but let's translate it...badly.

Bad Translator takes text and runs it through
multiple different languages giving you a

ridiculous result. So let's paste this palindrome...250
character limit...well...ok..so instead lets

take this description of the Taco Bell Dorito
Loco taco with the hopes that this shout out

will get me free Taco Bell, and translate
it back and forth 18 times until we get...this....mmmmmmm

For a different kind of translation, type
this into Google Translate, go from German

to Filipino and listen to some sweet beat
boxing.

There are more software easter eggs at The
Easter Egg Archive which cover everything
from movies, to videos games, to music.

And if you've ever wondered geographically
where people in America pronounce words differently,
these maps show you just that.

If your ear hurts
we can go explore it with the Interactive

Ear that gives you a look at how the human
ear actually works. You can navigate each

part in depth or take a journey through to
see what happens at each step.

Then continue on that path to find out what's
inside your head with Brain Maker. Type in
your name and see what is on your mind. I...uh...well...
WTFshould I do with my life? No, no...

I'll just go get Killed By Tetris, a game
where you have to avoid being crushed by the

tetris blocks as this cool little ninja dude
jumps off of walls and rolls onto blocks.

Or you could play Onomastica, a clever word
game where your character interacts with certain

words and letters to move forward, or downward
or upward.

For a more puzzling experience there is Za-ha-da,
a challenging riddle and puzzle game that

has you put the answers into the URL to get
to the next page. It gets increasingly difficult
so...

after rage quiting, go on a Duck Adventure,
an interactive story where you choose the

path of one duck and the life he leads by
making life's big choices for him.

Then lets go to masswerk.at/jakeisreallycool...oh
man, that page doesn't exist, it's just a
404 that lets you play space invader.

If you need some privacy use privnote dot
com where you send messages that can only
be read once before they self destruct.

Or try the Passive Aggressive Password Machine
if you feel like you should change your password.
Or not.... just do whatever I guess....

Because I'll be wasting my life away on the
great website PartyCloud where you are your

own DJ. Pick two songs, sync them together
then mix to your hearts content with different
effects, loops and filters.

As those sweet jams play in the background,
watch what google searches are happening,
right now.

And I heard a rumor that you cant do simple
maths under pressure but that is baloney because

you're smart and according to your mother,
you are very handsome. You can do addition,

subtraction and multiplication all while the
time limit gets shorter every round.

For something more relaxed test your knowledge
with what the movie where you guess the film
by only one screenshot.

And if Pac man were a horror movie it would
be called FPS-MAN and go something like this...

Then grab a friend and play Cube slam, the
latest google chrome experiment that is like

air hockey pong... but if your friends are
too afraid of your incredible video game-ability,
play against the computer.

Now lets fly around space, exploring and reading
messages that people all over the web have

left and you can leave your own, but once
you do, you explode.

Enjoy your death with a killer whale...that
follows your mouse.

and find some new music in obscure genres
like electroswing with PlaylisTunes.

I'm going to listen to a rainstorm with raining.fm
and pass out. And as always, thanks for watching.

comments.text:
Original text:

"Good morning. In less than an hour, aircraft from here will join others 
from around the world. And you will be launching the largest aerial battle 
in the history of mankind. Mankind; that word should have new meaning for 
all of us today. We can’t be consumed by our petty differences anymore. We 
will be united in our common interests. Perhaps it’s fate that today is the 
4th of July and you will once again be fighting for our freedom. Not from 
tyranny, oppression, or persecution, but from annihilation. We’re fighting 
for our right to live, to exist. And should we win the day, the 4th of July 
will no longer be known as an American holiday, but as the day when the 
world declared in one voice: ‘We will not go quietly into the night!’ ‘We 
will not vanish without a fight!’ ‘We’re going to live on!’ ‘We’re going to 
survive!’ Today we celebrate our Independence Day"

...43 translations later, Yandex gives us:

"Stored in a different world, within an hour, the world and the program. 
the greatest air battle in history. people today in America as a new 
concept, controversies and conflicts in the brain for what purpose, today, 
4 months, is free compressed air and pressure, and then destroy them. We 
have 4 months, during the war, of course,American holiday, but everything 
in this world sounds like a good night. don't give up without a fight!!!' 
What we need in life, I want to live!!! As we celebrate this independence 
Day."

Translated the speech from independence day﻿

comments.author: ZeJaka

comments.text:
Original text:"Abby then said to Jim, "Are you really loving 
me?""...43 translations later, Yandex gives us:"If you really like what I 
mean? "
Full translation log:


From English: Abby then said to Jim, "Are you really loving me?"
To Vietnamese: Cô Abby vậy thì nói với Jim, bạn Có thực sự yêu tôi?
Back to English: Abby then said to Jim, Did you really love me?
To Armenian: Ջոու քոուլը պաշտոնապես հետո ասել է Ջիմ, դու իսկապես սիրում ես 
ինձ?
Back to English: Abby once said, Jim, do you really love me?
To Azerbaijani: Эбби kimi-dedi, Cim, sən düzdür, məni sevirsən?
Back to English: Abby, he said, Jim, do you really love me?
To Belarusian: Эбі, ен сказаў, Джым, ты сапраўды мяне любіш?
Back to English: Abby, he said, Jim, do you really love me?
To Bosnian: Abby, on je rekao, Jim, da li ti stvarno voliš me?
Back to English: Abby, he said, Jim, do you really love me?
To Bulgarian: Аби, той каза, Джим, ти нали ме обичаш?
Back to English: Abby, he said, Jim, do you really love me?
To Catalan: Abby, va dir, Jim, el que realment m'estimes?
Back to English: Abby, he said, Jim, do you really love me?
To Chinese: 艾碧，他说，吉姆，你真的爱我吗？
Back to English: Abby, he said, Jim, do you really love me?
To Croatian: Abby, rekao je Jim, ti si istina me voliš?
Back to English: Abby said Jim, do you really love me?
To Czech: Abby řekl Jim, opravdu mě miluješ?
Back to English: Abby said to Them, you really love me?
To Danish: Abby sagde til Dem, at du virkelig elsker mig?
Back to English: Abby said to Them, that you really love me?
To Dutch: Abby zei tot Hen, dat je echt van me houdt?
Back to English: Abby said to Them, that you really love me?
To Ukranian: Еббі сказав їм, що ти дійсно любиш мене?
Back to English: Abby told them that you really love me?
To Finnish: Abby sanoi heille, että sinä todella rakastat minua?
Back to English: Abby said to them, that you really love me?
To Turkish: Abby beni gerçekten seviyorsan o, onlara dedi?
Back to English: Abby if you really love me then he said to them,?
To Georgian: Abby თუ მართლა გიყვარვარ მაშინ უთხრა მათ,?
Back to English: Abby if you really love me then he said to them,?
To Swedish: Abby om du verkligen älskar mig, då han sade till dem?
Back to English: Abby, if you really love me, then he said to them?
To Greek: Abby, αν πραγματικά αγαπάς, τότε αυτός είπε προς αυτούς;
Back to English: Abby, if you really love me, then he said to them?
To Slovenian: Abby, če ste res všeč mi je, potem je rekel, da jih?
Back to English: To network, if you really love me, then he said to them?
To Hungarian: A hálózat, ha igazán szeretsz engem, akkor ő azt mondta nekik?
Back to English: The network, if you really love me, then he said to them?
To Slovak: Siete, ak máte naozaj rád mnou, a potom im povedal?
Back to English: Network, if you really love me, and then told them?
To Indonesian: Jaringan, jika anda benar-benar cinta padaku, dan kemudian 
memberitahu mereka?
Back to English: Network, if you really love me, and then tell them?
To Italian: Di rete, se mi ami davvero, e poi dire loro?
Back to English: Network, if you really love me, and then tell them?
To Latvian: Tīkla, ja jūs patiešām mīlat mani, un pēc tam pastāstīt viņiem?
Back to English: Network, if you really love me, and then tell them?
To Lithuanian: Tinklo, jei jūs tikrai mane myli, ir tada pasakykite jiems?
Back to English: Network, if you really love me, and then tell them?
To Serbian: Мреже, ако заиста волиш ме, а онда ћу им рећи?
Back to English: Network if you really love me, and then I tell them?
To Malay: Jaringan jika anda benar-benar iove saya, dan maka saya katakan 
pada mereka?
Back to English: Network if you really love me, and then I tell them?
To Maltese: In-netwerk jekk verament iħobbu l-pr, u mbagħad I għidilhom?
Back to English: Network if you really love me, and then I tell them?
To Russian: Сети, если вы действительно любите меня, и тогда я им скажу?
Back to English: Network if you really love me, and then I say to them?
To Portuguese: De rede se você realmente gosta de mim, e então eu digo a 
eles?
Back to English: If you really like me, and so I say to them?
To Spanish: Si realmente me gusta, y a ellos les digo?
Back to English: If you really like it, and to them I say?
To Polish: Jeśli naprawdę go kochasz, i im mówię?
Back to English: If you really love him, and what I'm saying?
To Norwegian: Hvis du virkelig elsker ham, og det jeg sier?
Back to English: If you really love him, and what I'm saying?
To Macedonian: Ако навистина го сакам него, и она што јас го велам?
Back to English: If you really love him, and what I say?
To Estonian: Kui sa tõesti armastad teda, ja mida ma ütlen?
Back to English: If you really love him, and what I say?
To Hebrew: אם אתה באמת אוהב אותו, מה אני אומר?
Back to English: If you really like it, what I'm saying?
To Romanian: Dacă vă place foarte mult, despre ce vorbesc?
Back to English: If you really like what I'm saying?
To Thai: ถ้าคุณชอบจริงๆในสิ่งที่ฉันกำลังพูดมั๊ย?
Back to English: If you really like what I'm saying?
To German: Wenn Sie wirklich, wie, was ich sage?
Back to English: If you really like what I'm saying?
To Arabic: إذا كنت حقا مثل ما أنا تقول ؟ 
Back to English: If you really like what I'm saying? 
To French: Si vous aimez vraiment ce que je veux dire? 
Back to English: If you really like what I mean? 
To Albanian: Nëse ju me të vërtetë pëlqen çfarë dua të them? 
Back to English: If you really like what I mean?
